function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The use of screens may mitigate the risk of transmission for larger droplets, but may not effectively reduce the risk of airborne transmission (smaller droplets or droplet nuclei).","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission within a space.","Mitigation":"Carefully consider the positioning and number of ventilation inlets and outlets to reduce the risk of infection. Evaluate the impact on airflow patterns, air exchange, and environmental monitoring.","Technologies":"CFD simulations, carefully planned ventilation system changes.","People":"Occupants of the space, hospital patients, visitors, shop assistants, customers.","Owner":"Building managers, architects, ventilation system designers."},{"Description":"Installation of screens may lead to stagnant or recirculating airflow patterns, creating areas where viruses could accumulate.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus accumulation and transmission within certain areas of a space.","Mitigation":"Evaluate the impact on environmental monitoring and fire safety. Consider the potential implications for smoke detection and fire safety measures.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring tools, fire safety systems.","People":"Occupants of the space, building managers, fire safety personnel.","Owner":"Environmental monitoring staff, fire safety personnel, building managers."},{"Description":"Upper room ultra-violet germicidal irradiation (UVGI) may pose a risk if not implemented or maintained properly, leading to potential exposure to harmful UV radiation.","Impact":"Increased risk of UV radiation exposure for occupants within the space.","Mitigation":"Proper installation and maintenance of UVGI systems. Use of protective measures and regular inspections to ensure safe UVGI operation.","Technologies":"UVGI systems, protective measures.","People":"Occupants of the space, maintenance personnel, building managers.","Owner":"Maintenance personnel, building managers."}]}
